bibl.title: Adolph Krug vs. The United States of America. Journal Entry
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF ADOLPH KRUG FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELEASE, and other proceedings thereon.
div1.p: This cause coming on for hearing upon an order to show cause why a Writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue as prayed for in the Petition of Petitioner; the Court being advised upon the Petition, and upon hearing Counsel for Petitioner, denies and refuses to grant the said Writ. To which ruling of the Court Petitioner excepts, exception allowed.

Petitioner, thereupon, gives notice in open Court, that he appeals from the said ruling of the Court and from the whole and every part thereof, and appeals his said Petition and his said cause and the whole and each and every part thereof to the Circuit Supreme Court of Appeals of the United States for the Ninth Circuit, holding terms at the City of San Francisco, State of California Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and particularly appeals from the said ruling of the said Court denying and refusing to grant the said Writ of Habeas Corpus. Which said appeal is here and now allowed.
Done in Open Court this 8th day of March A. D. 1897,
div1.ab: In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.

In re Application of Adolph Krug for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and so forth,
Journal Entry

Jm. Hamilton Lewis STRATTON, LEWIS &
Attorney for Petitioner, 101-106 Occidental Block, Seattle.
div1.p:
Copy of within received and due service of the same acknowledged this day of 1896.
Atorney for.
div1.ab:
Filed March 8 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT A. REEVES AYRES CLERK
By A. N. Moore Deputy
